p: Seeds of E. globulus are exploited as a source of porous carbon, which proves its performance as a highly efficient supercapacitor and energy storage material [ 74]. Eucalyptus wood is a naturally renewable resource consisting of regularly ordered cells that contain different quantities of lignin, cellulose, and hemicelluloses [ 75]. It is commonly used as a fundamental material of cellulose pulp, timber, and panels [ 76]. Furthermore, for its corrosion resistance, Eucalyptus wood is largely used as a source of fuel in the construction and paper industries [ 62]. Moreover, wood sawdust from Eucalyptus trees is the pure substance from which activated carbon powder is made [ 77].
